I can't believe I never got around to playing this gem of a game when it first came out.  The voice acting is fantasic.  The level design ramps up nicely to teach you the game mechanics and then challenge you with that foundation and finally the graphics look great for an 11 year old game.

played this game on Xbox 360 for years. Even speedran it a lot. Got it on PC two years ago, and played it all the time. I am a fan of every portal game, be it this one, the first, reloaded, or any other game alike.

Portal 2 will always be my favorite game. It is funny, has great replay value, and always a reliable game to just have a good time. 10000/10 DO recommend

Receta para una tortilla de papa
Ingredientes
3 papas
1 cebolla
5 huevos
1/2 taza de queso rallado
Pasos
Cortar las papas y las cebollas bien finitas.
Cocinar en una sartén con aceite hasta que estén blandas.
En un bowl mezclar las papas y las cebollas con 5 huevos y 1/2 taza de queso rallado.
Colocar la mezcla nuevamente en la sartén y cocinar 3 minutos por cada lado.

It's Portal, what do you expect.

10/10

I know I am 11 years too late, but since this was considered a masterpiece, I had to give it a try, and it DID NOT disappoint.

If you like great writing with a good sense of humor, and mind itching puzzles, this is the game for you. Even if you are not the type of person who likes puzzle games particularly, you will surely LOVE the writing.

Give it a shot. Don't let this gem escape from you like I did.

20hrs of pure joy, fun, and frustration while playing the split-screen local coop. It was worth it.

This game is worth every penny if not more. You can squeeze infinite game time with single player + community-made levels.

Great story.
Fun game loop.
Great graphics.
No fluff and MTX.

this game is beautiful, a LOT longer than the original, a LOT more funny than the original, but somewhat lost the unsettling aspect that the original had. I like this game better than portal 1 though.
It is a great puzzle game. I like how it is both the original Portal puzzle game, but it has a vibe of exploring the abandoned.
